comments:
Running Teneo SDK 0.7.5.v200611290220.
Using Hibernate with HSQLDB.

Model consists of a class with a map containment reference.  The contained class has "key" and "value" attributes and an instance class of java.util.Map$Entry.

Calling put() on the map containment reference results in the following stack trace:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.joda.time.DateTime
	at com.csguy.continuousmusic.model.playtimehistory.impl.EventImpl.setValue(EventImpl.java:392)
	at org.eclipse.emf.teneo.mapping.elist.PersistableEList.newEntry(PersistableEList.java:633)
	at org.eclipse.emf.teneo.mapping.elist.PersistableEList.put(PersistableEList.java:569)
	at com.csguy.continuousmusic.model.playlists.impl.PlaylistManagerImpl.dispose(PlaylistManagerImpl.java:657)
	at com.csguy.continuousmusic.core.ContinuousMusicCorePlugin.stop(ContinuousMusicCorePlugin.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl$3.run(BundleContextImpl.java:1032)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.stop(BundleContextImpl.java:1028)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.stopWorker(BundleHost.java:396)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.stop(AbstractBundle.java:400)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.BundleStopper.basicStopBundles(BundleStopper.java:86)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.BundleStopper.stopBundles(BundleStopper.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseAdaptorHook.frameworkStopping(EclipseAdaptorHook.java:156)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.baseadaptor.BaseAdaptor.frameworkStopping(BaseAdaptor.java:288)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.shutdown(Framework.java:529)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.close(Framework.java:440)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.close(OSGi.java:41)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.shutdown(EclipseStarter.java:423)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:193)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

Debugging tracing points to the following Teneo code as the problem:

	public Object put(Object arg0, Object arg1) {
		Object entry = get(arg0);
		if (entry != null) {
			((Entry) entry).setValue(arg1);
			return entry;
		}
		entry = newEntry(arg0, arg0);  // <==== likely cause of bug
		add(entry);
		return entry;
	}


It looks to me like the suspected line should be:

		entry = newEntry(arg0, arg1);

This has been changed in cvs. Thanks for pointing me to the right location of the issue. I do not have a test case for this one. Let me know if it still fails after the next release (this week).

gr. Martin

This bug seems to be fixed in Teneo 0.7.5.v200701041633.

Thanks.
